messages.message: @hannah @Anil Can I understand how to do this? I have tried this, but then theres no indication that this env variable has been passed through (i.e get results does not show it)
The runtime_config is correctly passed in. The issue likely is that the new lambda UDF might not be making it available.
@Gwen out of curiosity, what do you expect to see in the results api with these run time configs?
The runtime configs are added to validation udf context. But I don’t think we added it to integrations. How are you trying to use these?

TBH I’d need them exposed on the Integrations part of the platform but was using the API to double check if its there

Theres two use cases thats been floated right now

1. I need it in integrations UDF; I.E: Salesforce Case ID is passed in, so when the fields are being extracted, the integration code can write to the right Salesforce Case
2. I need it in the validations UDF : @fernando.piazza.ctr a usecase where the customer wants to pass some fields in (i.e date or user id) and use that to compare to whats been extracted from the page. If it isnt correct it needs to be flagged - i reckon we could still use the custom python function integrations for this
@Eric Han oh - is it in validation UDFs?
yes. I’ll make a ticket to pipe it through to integraitons as well. We probably might want this through clean udfs i imagine
But also….how do i actually test if it is in the validation UDFs? I can only add a runtime config to a compiled app. When its not compiled, how does one dev on this?
ya we have a ticket for this already to improve the testing experience against run time configs in build
